questions.question_text: Which two protocols are supported for software image delivery when images are hosted on a remote server? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
Answer is DE

Selected Answer: DE
On a remote server: From Cisco vManage Release 20.7.1, you can store software images on a remote file server that is reachable through an FTP or HTTP URL

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/Monitor-And-Maintain/monitor-maintain-book/maintain.html

questions.question_text: An engineer is troubleshooting a certificate issue on vEdge. Which command is used to verify the validity of the certificates?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct
I'd go with A becuz it asks for certificates validity and this command shows both certificate and enterprise-cert validity.

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer. The question specifically asks which command verifies the validity of the certificate. While validity information is shown in option C (show certificate installed), option A has a line that specifically states: certificate-validity Valid/Invalid. Option A is the best command for rapid troubleshooting by a technician.
both commands run on a vEdge will show the cert validation and period

comments.content: show cert VALIDITY - not in the list of options..

sdwn01# show control local-properties
certificate-not-valid-before Aug 09 09:25:19 2017 GMT
certificate-not-valid-after Aug 09 09:25:19 2027 GMT
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sdwn01# show certificate validity 
The certificate is valid from Aug 9 09:25:19 2017 GMT (Current date is Wed Feb 1 11:36:51 GMT 2023) & valid until Aug 9 09:25:19 2027 GMT

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
For me "A" is correct since the question is about certificate on VEdge.
The option "C" is related to certificate on controllers vsmar, vbond, vmanger.
show certificate installed
show certificate installed—Display the decoded certificate signing request installed on a vBond orchestrator, vManage NMS or vSmart controller.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/command/sdwan-cr-book/operational-cmd.html#r_show_certificate_installed_3978.xml

Selected Answer: C
troubleshoot validity of certificate, focus on certificate in detail.
show certificate installed is the best choice

branch-vE1# show control local-properties
personality vedge
organization-name vIPtela Inc Regression
certificate-status Installed
root-ca-chain-status Installed

certificate-validity Valid
certificate-not-valid-before Sep 06 22:39:01 2018 GMT
certificate-not-valid-after Sep 06 22:39:01 2019 GMT
'show certificate installed' also shows the validity of the certificate, so...

Selected Answer: B
AppNav facilitates the distribution of packet flows to WAAS devices, which then optimize the traffic to improve application performance across the WAN.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Question refers specifically to the underlay whereas option D is both Underlay and Overlay

questions.question_text: Which two features are not supported when FIPS mode is enabled on a Cisco IOS XE SD-WAN device? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
Cisco TrustSec feature is not supported with Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) mode enabled. If FIPS mode is enabled, download of Protected Access Credential (PAC) key fails.

Selected Answer: CE
Limitations for SGT Propagation Using SXP in: 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/security/ios-xe-17/security-book-xe/cisco-trustsec-integration.html
